Hey lolzob. You are doing are REALLY good job with those XP/Win7/Win8 packs. Keep it up and ignore idiots writing stupid comments. I tested this version of WinXP and it works good, but I think you missed flash player this time (is mentioned in torrents description). In your windows packs it was listed under installed apps, in this case it's not. Everything else appears to work (.NET framework, player, sata drivers, power shell, bitlocker, even silverlight).
brother lolzob, what about the  " June edition 2013 " by your own effort ? when would you submit the latest month [ june]of Xp sp3 2013 version for us ?

@czeslawosso
I missed flash player? 
I think in the rush I forgot to integrate it.
Sorry!
Thank you for your encouraging words.
It would be nice if all people would appreciate my work. 
But, all fingers are not the same, and so people are not the same.

Can't wait for new releases of XP and 7 for june. Could you skip integration of flash player and silverlight? They both are not and essential part of windows, instead could you integrate .NET framework 4.0 (with security updates) into your Win7 releases? Integrating .NET frameworks into install makes later deployment less of a hassle. Everything else is fine. Thank you again. I'm a big fan of your releases, all tested, all working great.

Oh yeah. In my opinion with Windows XP you should stick to the SP3-SP4 formula, it's definitely better and more complete than just system security updates/hotfixes. But remember to change torrent name to SP3. It won't attract so many morons that way. ;)
